title: Danieli 2014 Premium Kisi (Kakheti)
description: Medium-gold to the eye, this wine has an interesting nose of grapefruit and coffee bean. It has flavors of pink grapefruit, almond paste, toast, vanilla and lemon curd and a slightly savory undercurrent on the palate that surges forward with notes of thyme and oregano on the finish.

title: Diego Conterno 2012  Barolo
description: Aromas recalling weedy underbrush, toast and cured meat take shape in the glass. The palate shows licorice, black-cherry extract and a green note of powdered sage alongside bracing tannins that squeeze the finish.

title: Domaine Carrette 2014 Les Mûres  (Saint-Véran)
description: This wine is buttery and has a creamy texture along with a fresh streak. Apple flavors are lifted with citrus while also filled out with that rounder character, making for an immediately attractive, ripe wine. Drink now.

title: Basilicus 2012 Once Upon a Time White (Tokaj)
description: This Hungarian white has aromas of peach, apricot, citrus blossom and vanilla bean. In the mouth, there are flavors of caramelized apple and wet river rock.

title: Björnson 2014 Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Estate-grown, though it is not indicated on the label, this matches black raspberries to a lightly toasty frame. The wine spent just under a year in French oak prior to bottling. The fruit and oak components are in good proportion, but another year or two in bottle will help to meld the flavors.

title: Bodega Chacra 2015 Barda Pinot Noir (Patagonia)
description: Spicy, medicinal cherry, tomato and herb aromas lead to a palate with rubbery tannins and moderate astringency. A fresh and tasty mix of spicy, rooty berry flavors ends with brushy, herbal, chocolaty notes on the finish.

title: Bret Brothers 2014 Terroir du Mâconnais  (Mâcon-Villages)
description: This wine, a blend from many Mâcon vineyards, is crisp and full of acidity, making it bright and tangy. Its freshness is up front with apple and citrus fruits. The mineral texture gives an attractive tautness, and the wine is drinkable now.

title: Casa do Valle 2015 Branco White (Vinho Verde)
description: Vineyards just across the hills from the Douro have produced this ripe wine. It has fine acidity that gives freshness to the apple, peach and ripe pear fruits. The aftertaste is bright, tight with minerality and citrus. Drink now.

title: Casa Montes 2012 Don Baltazar Malbec (San Juan)
description: Stout up front, the nose is packed with black-fruit aromas. The palate feels a bit prickly and raw, while blackberry flavors run quick, with a chocolaty oak character popping up on a lean finish.

title: Casca Wines 2015 Monte Cascas Reserva White (Douro)
description: Viosinho and Gouveio, two classic Douro white grapes are blended in this ripe wood-aged wine. It has spice as well as rounded fruit, giving the wine a ripe character that is balanced with final citrus acidity. Drink now.

title: St. Donat 2013 Márga White (Balaton)
description: This Furmint, grown in marl soils, has aromas of brioche, apple tart and caramelized pear and flavors of lemon-lime juice, green apple and lime blossom before a crisp clean finish.

title: Raineri Gianmatteo 2012 Monserra  (Barolo)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting mature berry, baking spice, menthol, scorched earth and oak. The ripe palate offers stewed prune and bitter chocolate while assertive, tightly wound tannins grip the finish.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2013 Fourchaume Premier Cru  (Chablis)
description: Soft and buttery, this wine is smooth and creamy with hints of citrus and a tangy backdrop. With a lightly toasty edge, the wine finishes more tightly than it starts. Drink now.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2015  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: With touches of the typical minerality of the appellation, this is a young, tight wine. Crisp apple, lemon and spice add interest to this perfumed wine. It will be better to drink from 2017.

title: Jaffelin 2014  Chorey-lès-Beaune
description: This is a generous wine, full of red-berry fruitiness and acidity with firm tannins. It is almost ready to drink. Wait until 2017.

title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Les Dames Huguettes Vieilles Vignes  (Hautes Côtes de Nuits)
description: From the Aegerter domaine, this wine is full of spicy red fruits. It comes from a vineyard in the hills above Nuits Saint-Georges, and the cooler elevation shows in the acidity and fresh fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.

title: McPherson 2014 Les Copains Red (Texas)
description: This Rhône-style red blend is light bodied and fruit forward, with slight spice nuances to add interest. Cranberry, pink peppercorns and anise show good balance and concentration on the nose and palate.

title: McPherson 2015 Timmons Ranch Piquepoul Blanc (Texas)
description: It's not often you find a varietal Piquepoul Blanc outside of the south of France, but this seems to suit well to the hot Texan climate. Striking notes of ripe peach, apricot and white lily carry the nose and palate. There's good tension and texture in this light- to medium-bodied wine, which would lend well to pairing alongside grilled seafood.

title: Fullerton 2014 Croft Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Coming on stiff and herbal, the Croft needs some time and patience. There are not quite resolved streaks of citrus, cherries, earthy tannins and a touch of cocoa powder. Still a baby, this should improve over the next three to five years.

title: Gehricke 2014 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: An elegant, restrained wine from the earthy appellation cooled by Pacific Ocean winds, this wine conveys a plethora of pretty clove, tea and rose petals, finished in cinnamon stick and vanilla.

title: Lumos 2014 Wren Vineyard Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Softly fruity, this brings a gentle wash of bananas and cream, with a touch of caramel. If that sounds appealing, it is indeed, as it glides along a seamless finish. Drink now through 2018.

title: Gian Piero Marrone 2011 Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Earthy aromas of truffle, game, ripe dark-skinned fruit and scorched soil lead the nose. The firmly structured palate shows dense cranberry, dried Morello cherry, game and a touch of clove alongside close-grained tannins. Let the tannins unwind then drink up.

title: Domaine Edmond Cornu 2014  Chorey-lès-Beaune
description: This wine is fruity and ripe with fresh red-berry fruits and layers of smoky tannins. Those tannins will open up to give a rich, juicy and spicy wine from 2018.

title: Fenestra 2012 Ghielmetti Vineyard Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine has a bright cherry character in the aromas and flavors along with medium body and a dry, firm texture. Lighter than many of its peers, but still cloaked in lots of fine tannins, it will improve with time. Wait until 2020.

title: Hacormim 2014 Adi 13 Cabernet Sauvignon (Israel)
description: Aromas of cherry, orange zest and vanilla custard set the stage for flavors of blackberry, blueberry, mocha, anise and flame-broiled meat. It is bright on entry, with soft but ever-present tannins. The finish features a burst of brightness and a note of aniseed.

title: Hyland 2014 Founders' Selection Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: This opens with pretty cherry fruit flavors, underscored with a touch of mineral and mocha. But there it ends, feeling one dimensional and fading fast in the finish. Three bottles tasted with similar results.

title: Orgo 2014 Saperavi (Kakheti)
description: Deep violet-red to the eye, this wine has a nose of cherry, strawberry and toffee. It is a bit sharp at first sip, with flavors of tart cherry, lingonberry, thyme and white chocolate. Tannins are very soft on entry but gradually coat the entire palate.

title: Renzo Seghesio 2008 Riserva Pajana  (Barolo)
description: Menthol, leather and underbrush aromas lead the nose while the dense palate offers raw sour cherry and dried sage. Bracing tannins grip the finish.

title: Rivetti Massimo 2013  Barbaresco
description: Scents of cocoa, ripe berry and a balsamic note come together on this. The jammy, straightforward palate offers dark cherry, raspberry, coffee and a hint of licorice alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Roadhouse Winery 2014 Black Label Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the Nunes Vineyard, this robust red is concentrated in black cherry, tar and cinnamon spice, full bodied from having been cradled in French oak, 20% of it new. The acidity and body are both medium level, while the ripeness is high.
